txt.en: You have looked all around the ice spire for signs of what might have made it appear, and spied Núrzum's footprints heading westward.\n\nWhile it is clear that Núrzum left this strange mark upon the land, you saw no sign of any artifact or relic.
A Violent Slice of Winter
The waters of the Isingmere are clear, and you see no sign of any artifact
This is a good spot to look northward
This is not a good place to look
You have discovered a strange spire of ice and snow near the edge of the Isingmere, as if a terrible storm lingered in this one small spot.
Wherever Núrzum has decided to go, he has left Forlaw alone...for now

The snow will be less blinding to the north, south, east, and west of this ice-spire near the Isingmere lake in the south-east Whithsaws.

You should start by walking north and <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> for signs of what caused this strange structure to appear on the plains.

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This quest requires emotes.</rgb>
This is a good spot to look eastward

You have looked all around the ice spire for signs of what might have made it appear, and spied Núrzum's footprints heading westward.\n\nWhile it is clear that Núrzum left this strange mark upon the land, you saw no sign of any artifact or relic.
This is not a good place to look
Wolves from distant lands now prowl the frozen plains to the south
This is a good spot to look southward
This is not a good place to look
Investigate the ice-spire
Go north of the spire and <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> for signs
Go east of the spire and <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> for signs
Go south of the spire and <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> for signs
Go west of the spire and <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> for signs
Completed
Núrzum's footprints lead away to the north-west, deeper into the Whitshaws, towards Dunfast
This is a good spot to look westward
This is not a good place to look
You have discovered a strange spire of ice and snow near the edge of the Isingmere, as if a terrible storm lingered in this one small spot.

You have come upon a great spire of ice and snow, and the chill in this spot cuts to your very bones. Uneasiness settles in as you stand in this place blinded by snow.\n\nYou should look to the north, south, east, and west of this site for any signs of what you've encountered here.
